title.narrative: Emergency 2007 Cyclone Recovery and Restoration Project

description.narrative: The PDO is to support the Government of Bangladesh efforts to facilitate recovery from the damage to livelihoods and infrastructure caused by Cyclone Sidr and to build long-term preparedness through strengthened disaster risk reduction and management.

participating-org.narrative: Bangladesh Water Development Board, Ministry of Water Resources
Department of Fisheries, Ministry of Fisheries and Livestock
Department of Livestock Services, Ministry of Fisheries and Livestock
Departmnent of Agricultural Extension, Ministry of Agriculture
Government of the People's Republic of Bangladesh
Project Coordination and Monitoring Unit, Programming Division, Planning Commission

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :FA, Sched 2, Section I, A.2 | Description :Recipient shall (i)maintain a Project Steering Committee with theterms of ref and composition and (ii) IAs appoint and maintain key staff acceptable to the Association | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :FA, Sched 2, Section I, C.1.a | Description :Recipient prior to awarding any works contracts will prepare anenvironmental and social/resettlement management framework | Frequency :Monthly
Finance Agreement :FA, Sched 2, Section I, C.2 | Description :Recipient shall obtain prior approval of the Association beforeacquiring any land | Frequency :Monthly
Finance Agreement :FA, Sched 2, Section II, A.1.a | Description :Recipient shall monitor and evaluate the progress of the Projectand prepare quarterly reports | Frequency :Monthly
Finance Agreement :FA, Sched 2, Section II, B.1 | Description :Recipient shall ensure that financial statements are preparedaccording to standards acceptable to the Association | Frequency :Quarterly

title.narrative: Number of emergency vehicles for effective communication and response to disasters
Number of newly constructed shelters with improved design standards and connectivity with the community
Length of coastal embankments including appurtenant structures rehabilitated and upgraded with improved design standards
Recovery of agriculture sector and livelihoods for cyclone affected populations
Number of Aquaculture packages (Carp, Golda, Bagda+Tilapia) distributed
Number of Farmers’ Field School (FFS) formed
Number of Agriculture Equipment (Power tillers, Power threshers, Hand sprayer) distributed
Number of dairy production facilities (cattle sheds and portable poultry sheds) distributed
Numbers of shelters repaired and improved upon with improved connectivity (such as access roads) with the community
Reduced risk to cyclone affected population due to rehabilitation of protective infrastructure (e.g. embankments, disaster shelters)
Household survey completed at MTR and once in every year thereafter

actual.value: 4 (HH survey report at MTR in 2012, Project Evaluation Report in 2013, Project Evaluation Report in 2014 and Impact Evaluation in2018)

title.narrative: Strengthened disaster risk management in the government

actual.value: Emergency equipment in use Early Warning System (EWS) set up

title.narrative: Detailed multi-hazard models are used to generate maps

target.value: MRVA Maps and Atlas generated and used

actual.value: Final Multi-hazard Risk and Vulnerability Assessment (MRVA), Model and Map submitted

title.narrative: Timely submission of quarterly M&E reports
Preparation of future operations for the long-term disaster risk reduction program. This includes, RMIP, CEIP, and MDSP.

target.value: Completion of preparation and study reports including design and bidding documents

actual.value: CEIP, MDSP under implementation, RMIP (RBIP) negotiated.

title.narrative: PCMU to capture the results of the project components and submit report at MTR and at project closing

actual.value: Final Report to be submitted at Project Closing

title.narrative: Support Strategic study and detailed design for a pilot project identified during project implementation

target.value: Support Strategic study and detailed design for a pilot project identified during project implementation

actual.value: Strategic studies and detailed designs carried out during implementation. The Coastal Embankment Improvement Project (CEIP) and theMultipurpose Disaster Shelter Project (MDSP) are now under implementation. The River Management Improvement Project (RMIP) wasNegotiated.
